pr_title: Support using table functions with multiple columns in select list

timeline.message: WIP: Support using table functions with multiple columns in select list
WIP: Support using table functions with multiple columns in select list

Support using table functions with multiple columns in select list

This introduces a new `RowType` that represents expressions which have a
`Row` as value. This is necessary to supporting using table functions
with multiple columns in the select list of a statement.

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to handle the array of row type separately, such as we have a special handling for RowType.
timeline.author: kovrus

timeline.bodyText: should we have some pre condition here to be more safe and get a better exception message if we get out of bound exception.
timeline.author: kovrus

replies.bodyText: Not sure, I think the out-of-bounds exception that will be raised is fairly fitting.
replies.author: mfussenegger

timeline.bodyText: not sure, maybe we can first check Row#numColumns of val1 and val2?
timeline.author: kovrus

replies.bodyText: I added an assertion to make sure they have the same size. I think comparing different rows to each other shouldn't be allowed. (This here is for sorting, and we can't sort different row values).
replies.author: mfussenegger

timeline.bodyText: shall we add regproc to aliases in data-types.rst?
timeline.author: kovrus
timeline.diffHunk:

         entry("int4", INTEGER),
         entry("int8", LONG),
         entry("name", STRING),
+        entry("regproc", STRING),
